column4: If you want users to be able to have web pages on the server, the usual thing is to allow them to use ~/public_html
The usual procedure to allow each user of a machine to have their own web pages is to configure apache to access a public_html directory in each users account.
The pages are then access by http://url-for-server/~username/
Any directory can be made the default for use with apache. Just set the entry for "Directory /" in /etc/apache2/sites-available/default
